description: A 60-second lesson on The Kuiper Belt.

hook.text: Beyond Neptune lies a vast region of icy objects stretching billions of kilometers.

buildup.text: The Kuiper Belt is home to Pluto, Eris, and thousands of similar frozen worlds.

discovery.text: It's a fossil record of the early solar system â€” material that never became a planet.

twist.text: Many short-period comets actually originate here before falling toward the Sun.

climax.text: New Horizons reached the Kuiper Belt object Arrokoth in 2019 â€” it looked like a snowman.

punchline.text: The solar system doesn't end at Neptune. It barely begins.

quiz.question: What is the Kuiper Belt?
options: A region of icy objects beyond Neptune
A ring of asteroids near Mars
A cloud of gas around the Sun
